result.execSummary:
The defendant Dom Mont was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Early termination may be granted after 9 months with Agent approval and no new criminal law violations.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Any additional conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with Shannon H, her residence or place of employment.
Attend Anger Management Treatment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dom Mont

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dom  Mont in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant's father addresses the Court.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #2:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS JAIL;

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR; Early termination after 9 months with agent recommendation and no new criminal law violations.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Any terms deemded appropriate by the Agent.
*No contact with:  Shannon H., her residence or place of employment.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Attend Anger Mangement Treatment.
*Perform 50 hours Community Service.

COURT COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

Defendant Dom  Mont in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2 of the amended complaint.  Court finds defendant guilty of count #2 of the amended complaint.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
